meanings.definition: Present participle of circumstantiate: to provide evidence or details to support a claim
meanings.sent1: She was circumstantiating her argument with facts and figures.
meanings.sent2: The detective was circumstantiating the case with witness testimonies.
meanings.sent3: John was circumstantiating his excuse for being late with a detailed story.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were circumstantiating her loyalty to the company.
meanings.sent5: The photos circumstantiating the crime scene were crucial for the investigation.

meanings.definition: Present participle of circumstantiate: to give a detailed account or description of something
meanings.sent1: The historian was circumstantiating the events of the battle in his book.
meanings.sent2: She was circumstantiating the recipe with step-by-step instructions.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was circumstantiating his hilarious adventure with exaggerated details.
meanings.sent4: Her words were circumstantiating the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist was circumstantiating the painting with intricate brush strokes.

meanings.definition: Present participle of circumstantiate: to establish the circumstances surrounding an event or situation
meanings.sent1: The journalist was circumstantiating the political scandal with interviews.
meanings.sent2: They were circumstantiating the accident by collecting eyewitness accounts.
meanings.sent3: The children were circumstantiating their imaginary world with rules and roles.
meanings.sent4: His presence was circumstantiating the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The weather was circumstantiating the mood of the outdoor party.
